tika.dc.description:
An ultra-gritty piece of contemporary Swedish noir, set in a decrepit, highly atmospheric 1930s Stockholm that is a far cry from the modern, egalitarian capital city of today. Harry Kvist, the perfect fall guy, becomes the primary suspect in a murder. The only witness certain to get him acquitted, a prostitiute named Sonja, disappeared without a trace. While he searches for Sonja, Harry must evade the law and also the real killer(s) who framed him.

Stockholm, 1932. Harry Kvist is a bisexual former boxer, scarred by both poverty and alcoholism, now working as a debt collector. One night the debtor Zetterberg is murdered, after one of Kvist's house calls. Kvist becomes the main suspect, a perfect fall guy complete with a sordid past and previous dealings with the law. The only witness certain to get him acquitted is Sonja, a prostitute, who has disappeared without trace.

In an attempt to clear his name, he sets out on a hunt through the poverty-stricken capital city,...
